review: I had cellulitis on my face, which swelled up significantly. Having worked in healthcare as a nursing aid for several years, I knew it the diagnosis before the physician confirmed it and realized antibiotics would be necessary. What I didn’t expect was a horrendous neuropsychiatric reaction to the medication. I was extremely nervous and could not sleep on day 3 and ended up having a severe anxiety attack. The episodic depression and odd behaviour such as standing in one place without moving for hours was frightening. Thankfully, after 2 MORE hospital visits, I was put on a Cephalosporin which eliminated the anxiety. My family physician has put this medication on my chart with beside the penicillin allergy (anaphylaxis) and wrote neuropsychiatric reaction. Bactrim is BY FAR the WORST medication I’ve ever be on.

I've taken Bactrim in the past,  usually just have gastrointestinal issues.  This time,  beginning day 3 of 7 I felt like I was hypoglycemic, nervous, jittery, anxious, and like my heart was racing.  Day 6 of 7 my resting heart rate was 142, anxiety so bad I was crying. I called the hospital that prescribed it and the nurses spoke to "talked to TWO doctors and NEVER heard of ANYTHING like that" I said "never mind that it's listed under severe side effects right?" I stopped taking it then (Dr said I could keep taking it or stop, it doesn't matter) 24 hours later,  I'm back to normal.  Resting heart rate is 83. I'll never take Bactrim again.

I was prescribed this drug for a boil I’ve been getting since 16 and I’m 23 and I’ve been to the hospital and have had many minor surgeries and I can say this def work and after I had the abscess lanced it had sealed back up within 5 days of taking this it had brought the boil back to a head again so I could drain it to relieve the pain and abscess!! And just makes my knees hurt from time to time

After I got what I thought was just a minor infection from a wound caused by an ill-fitting pair of Vans, things progressed to the point where I had a festering boil on my right foot. This was alarming, since I'm not immunocompromised, but I ended up spiking a fever of 102 degrees and was rushed to urgent care. The doctor had prescribed bactrim for the infection, specifcally 800/160mg of Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim. I learned that this was a staph infection 3 days later when the wound culture results came back. The bactrim worked perfectly, with my staph infection clearing up in about a week, although it had made my acne slightly worse due to "purging." Apart from worsening acne, there were no other side effects. The pills were large but easy to swallow.

Bactrim is extremely effective - where other antibiotics might fail - but many doctors seem to underestimate the severity of side-effects (including uncommon ones). It is always difficult for me to be consistent with Bactrim dosage because I experience severe nausea and bouts of dizziness. It may be easy to complain, but I also recognise that an alternative might not be appropriate. Instead, I asked to also be prescribed anti-nausea medication. It's not fun, but it can be tolerable.

I am sharing my experience because I want others to know there is hope from recovering from the extremely rare and life changing side effects that happened to me on Bactrim. I took it for 3 weeks for recurring acne cysts that kept forming behind my ear that started with an abscess being drained in front of my ear. The first week I felt ok but by the 2nd I could hardly eat and felt depressed and anxious. I quit taking it and the cysts kept coming so the dermatologist told me to keep taking it to clear up the infection. At 3 weeks I woke up with knee joint pain and a couple days later noticed my calves got very sore from doing normal things. I immediately quit the Bactrim but it was too late. A week later the pain was worse and I was very scared. Had every blood test done, MRIs on my knee and calf, and everything normal. I got worse as the months progressed and finally 6 months later I began to feel better. Had to quit my amazing job and was in the most depressed state  I'm healthy and 31 female.

DO NOT take this if you are an athlete. 3 days into my treatment for a staph infection I started developing bilateral ankle pain. I brushed it off as nothing. However, the pain gradually increased over the next several days. By day 8 of my 10 day course my ankle pain was terrible. I have never had any ankle problems in my life until now! It feels like I am 90 years old! On top of that my achilles' also started acting up. I stopped the course right then. Yes, the medicine cleared up the infection, but the alternatives could have done the same. 4 days post last dose and I am still experiencing ankle pain and am currently unable to do any sort athletic activity. I am hoping this goes away soon. Demand an alternative if you are prescribed this. I would rather poop water for a month straight from an antibiotic than have what feels like an arthritic ankle!

I have lymphodema so I get open sores on my legs.  I scratch and that leads to cellulitis.  I've tried many drugs with no luck until they gave me Bactrim.  10 day supply with instant healing and clears it up until I scratch again.  No side effects and its a miracle drug!
Cured the abscesses, MRSA, and cellulitis.

I went to dermatologists for five years because of cysts/boils that were on my butt. I'd get one, it would go away, and I'd get another one. Doctors would put me on expensive medication that did nothing. Then I found the best dermatologist in the city and waited for four months to see him.  The doctor said I would take Bactrim/sulfa 500mg 2x's a day for 30 days. I did that and they disappeared. He said some people have to take them for life, others would take them for 10 days when you have any little sign or a boil or cyst. I start taking the medication and the cyst or boil disappears.  What a miracle treatment it's been to me as a person prone to cysts and boils!!!

I had a facial abscess lanced at urgent care and prescribed Bactrim in case it was MRSA. I took it for about 8 days twice daily and lost my appetite, got headaches and felt anxious and depressed. I continued to get cystic acne behind my ears, mostly the ear by the abscess that was drained so the dermatologist PA told me to take Bactrim for another month, once a day.  I took it another 12 days until I began having knee joint pain and achyness in my legs like I've got the flu. Oh I was also getting the chills. I've been off it 3 days and still having very bad leg pain that's caused me to have a panic attack and extreme mood swings and depression. I know it's from this antibiotic... I'm praying that the pain goes away as is debilitating and I was a healthy 30 year old prior to this.

So many negative reviews on this bactrim that it surprised me because it worked great for me and I didn’t notice any adverse conditions whatsoever. Maybe only negative people write reviews and all the positive ones are out playing and don’t have time to write. Thanks Doc. good call on my meds.

Was prescribed Bactrim-DS BID for 10 days for an infected cut on my wrist from punching glass.The first 2 days was HORRIBLE. I was tachycardic, nauseous, gassy, itchy on arms/legs & had no appetite, jaw clenching & severe panic attacks. Plus, my symptoms were just getting worse. I was forming clusters of stinging/itching blisters around my cuts, my wrist was swollen & warm to the touch, & I felt feverish.I ended up getting prescribed Keflex to take with Bactrim starting Day 3. Side effects subsided & symptoms got better. Some nights I'd wake up at 3AM with a panic attack that lasted until I took my next dose. Other nights I'd be able to sleep just fine. Days 6-7, I got gas pain that felt like chest pain. The side effects didn't get better until Day 8. By then, all I had was some itchiness but no full-on rash.I never want to take this drug again. I give it 3 stars only because it did treat my infection despite taking all 10 days and all my willpower to pull through.

I had a large abscess on my abdomen and was first put on Keflex. After a few days, the infection was spreading and I now had diarrhea. The clinic doctor switched me to bactrim. I was nervous after reading reviews, but by the next day I saw major improvement. I finished my full course and I feel great. It didn’t even upset my stomach. Obviously some people have allergic reactions to it, but for me it worked wonderfully.

Treated with Bactrim for MRSA. This drug ruin my life. Bactrim is a very strong drug. This is over a year now I’ve taken Bactrim and it left me with a number of side effects up until now a whole year later with weight loss, stomach problems, tightness in the throat, rash, depression, lymph nodes and other feelings I can’t describe. Please stay far away from this drug because I can’t understand how this drug  is prescribed for so many different things to begin with and it’s just making everyone worst than after they take it.

Had an abcess removed and was prescribed Bactrim. Could not stay awake and got more sick every time I took it. Had most of the symptoms they say to contact your doctor about. Called and was told unless I had a rash there was no reason not to keep taking it. I could not function had an extreme migraine which I have never had before (sensitivity to light and sound). Upset stomach, trouble passing urine, leg pain, chills, fever among others.

Got a nasty couple of mosquito bites that ended up streaking up my arms. Was prescribed Bactrim for the bacterial skin infection. First few days, my tummy was bad, and not sleeping well. On the 7th day, I suddenly had the worst chills/shivers and low fever. By morning my arms, legs and torso covered in rash. Went to ER and they immediately determined it was a Bactrim reaction. Said the drug is known to have nasty reactions and not sure why I was prescribed it when there are alternatives. If you have an alternative drug that just as effective, not worth the risk.

Prescribe Bactrim 2 day for 10 days for a Stye. The 7th day I had my allergic reaction. All over body rash, fever, chills, severe leg pain, chemical burns/ulcers in ALL soft tissue areas (nose, eyes, mouth, and "down below"...), abdominal pain, diarrhea, zero appetite, headache, nausea, elevated kidney function test.  Bactrim is KNOWN and has a LONG HISTORY of hurting more than helping. STAY AWAY!!

Took Bactrim for Folliculitis. First 7 days I only had vomiting and nausea but on Day 8 I started getting fevers, intense shaking, throbbing headache, sweating, vomiting, insomnia, depression. I never felt this sick ever. It took me a while to realize it was the antibiotic. Once I stopped taking it I broke out in a rash. Ended up having a sulfa allergy. Please be cautious when taking this. There was one point where I just wanted to call 911 I was in so much agony... it did help clear up much of the infection

The 4th day of taking it (along with Cephalexin) for a wound on my ankle that became inflamed and appeared infected.  I’m currently recovering from the 4th anxiety and depression episode in my life (I’m 53) so have to keep that in mind. This drug doesn’t affect my GI system at all. I am taking a probiotic with it. What it does do is increase my anxiety and depression which I experience as hot flushes, sweating, pounding heart, gloominess.  It is distressing. I am trying to push thru because it is helping the wound heal. But if you are one of us folks who suffers anxiety and/or depression, please just be aware that it may exacerbate your symptoms.

Was prescribed to take 2 pills a day for 5 days to clear a boil that hadn’t popped yet. Worst decision to take. After 1 pill I had stomach cramps, nausea, diarrhea and some jitters. I took the 2nd pill after consulting a family friend that is a doctor in another state and the jitters got worse, my heart rate went up and I woke up in the middle of the night having a panic attack. Consulted my family friend again (since couldn’t reach my doctor) and he agreed to stop the medicine since the side effects were worse than the potential benefit. Threw out the bottle and will be chatting with my doctor and maybe get a second opinion soon.

This was the worst experience of my life. Four days after starting this medicine, the backs of my thighs starting itching like crazy for about 2 hours, I took some benadryl and it seemed to help. But then came the pain. It started in my calves. It was like pins and needles. I couldn't sleep. Then it moved to my feet. Then to my arms and hands. It was so scary!! I didn't/couldn't sleep for 2 days straight. Finally a doctor put me on steroids and some Hydrocodon for the pain. It was horrible and I would not recommend this drug to anyone!

I was prescribed Bactrim for a sinus infection, staph infection in my nose and infected toe nail.  I haven’t had any side effects.  I’ve taken it a few days and hoping for good results.  The is my second round of antibiotics

Was prescribed bactrim for a 'possible' infection in my leg from varicose veins. 2 pills a day for 10 days.Worst medication. Felt fine with the first pill, after the second pill I started to have bladder issues. Was peeing constantly, bladder felt heavy. Felt like I had to go after I just went. Was checked for a UTI, don't have one. Only took 2 pills and stopped. It has also caused headaches, my abdominal muscles feel weaker, loss of appetite. I must have been allergic or something.. Won't ever take this again.

I was prescribed Bactrim for 10 day course to treat Staph infection in my skin. I had no issues other than fatigue for first 6 days but by day 7 I woke up feeling dizzy and so tired. I kept pushing on taking the tablets because it was working to clear boils. By day 8-9 I had a rash over my body. I felt so lightheaded. Even laying down my body ached as if I had the flu.

I started getting boils about a couple of years ago. And they are the worse! Took me along time to figure out what I could do to get some relief and make them go away. My dr prescribes me Bactrim and it starts to relieve the pressure and they start going down within 24 hours. I also like to put this boil salve on them with a bandaid, to keep it on there and without a mess. And the two work great! I see a lot of bad reviews. Well I have had bad anxiety/panic attacks for over 10 years now and Bactrim does not make it any worse. I don't have any side effects from this antibiotic. It works great for me. Some people may read reviews that are bad and they may think themselves into a panic attack. If you're allergic to it, that's another thing. Can't do anything for that. I'm just happy I have found an antibiotic that gets rid of these severe painful boils!

I had an inflamed bug bite on my leg and was prescribed bactrim. I ate and took the first and only dose that night at around 8pm. Around 3ish in the morning my head was throbbing, I was insanely warm with a 102 degree fever, meanwhile having chills at the same time. What bothered me the most is my hands swelled, were red and I had intense itching. I'm still experiencing these symptoms so I don't know when they will stop.

I had an ingrown toe nail so my pod. removed it & put me on cephalexin for a week. After taking all of them my toe was still infected. She put me on Bactrim to be taken twice a day for 10 days. 24 hours after my first dose my mood completely changed I was depressed & miserable. Day2 I was spinning it was impossible to function for daily tasks, & I had no appetite. Day 3 had a full blown panic attack then extreme anxiety & following that several heart palpitations. Day6 I had a rash across my midsection. I stopped taking them that day and called my pod. as my toe still wasn't getting better. She advised I stop & see her later on that day. She wound up removing another piece of nail that had been left behind. When I told her all of the symptoms she said that I'm allergic. As a person who suffers from food allergies this terrified me. After a week the nausea, headache & spinning started to lighten up but it took around two months to get back to my normal routine. And to think...these symptoms are NORMAL for this medication.

I was diagnosed with cellulitis in my elbow. The doctor gave me a shot of bactrim in my bum and sent me home with a prescription for Bactrim 2 times a day. I took it for 4 days and I developed severe anxiety, chilled, over heating, ringing in my ears and full body rash. I was told to stop taking it and then they gave me prednisone which made me depressed and full of rage .This medication is awful.

Was misdiagnosed with cellulitis later went to a podiatrist who removed ingrown toenail that was infected I didn’t even need this bactrim gave me intense shooting burning pains all over my body high blood pressure severe dehydration a fever and panic attacks back to back. I was shaking violently from being so cold I could not feel my limbs but they were on fire at the same time poison

This has been my first go to antibiotic. I am allergic to so many. Yes it’s an older antibiotic and have to take longer than most . I know my systems for allergic reactions , but I do know what works best for me.

Took  bactrim  4 days for skin infection then quit due to not sleeping or being able to eat, I drank plenty of water but ended up feeling like my head was going to explode, joints aching, vision blurry, felt like I was being poisoned.  The  doctor said to continue taking just make sure you eat I let them know I was not able to eat, so I quit on my own nobody's going to know what is going on with their body better than themselves and it was just poisoning me. Three days after stopping Bactrim I have rash all over body  and a week later still feel like my head is going to explode, very tired and vision blurry. Doctors put on my file to never take again as I am allergic to it

I got a staph infection with boil on my arm and was prescribed Bactrim 2x/day for 10 days. Started on 7/3. The large hard painless boil lump did not subside but did not get worse so there’s that, but possibly it was already contained. I admit I did not drink tons of water. 7 days in, on 7/10 I got a huge red dot rash and itchy hive plaques on my inner forearms and upper thighs. Took Benadryl at night but woke up a couple hours in with itchy heels and big hive plaques on my butt cheeks, so couldn't sleep. This went on for days, where a new area would rise and bump up, like all over my back, arms and chest.Aantihistamines helped with the itch a little but the weird skin was still there. I stopped Bactrim on 7/11. Hives stayed until end of 7/15. May come back. Read this drug can lead to Steven Johnsons Syndrome- yikes.

My son was prescribed this drug after being hospitalized for an eczema infection. Then 7 days later he is covered in pin dotted rash and high fever due to bactrim.  The Dr told me to give him benadryl every 4 hours for now.  He can't sleep at night, I'm worried his rash will get worse and he will stop breathing. Dr says to rush him to the ER if symptoms get worse. This drug should not be given to a 9 year old.

Posting my experience to hopefully put some minds at ease as reading these reviews really scared me! I am very sensitive to antibiotics and have had adverse reactions to the past three I have taken. I was prescribed Bactrim for a nasty spider bite to help it & prevent further infection. On day two I already experience immense relief from the pain and the bite started to shrink. I now am on day five and have had no side effects at all except some fatigue and minor nausea at night. Definitely bearable. Be sure to take a probiotic and remember everyone’s body is different! I am happy I finally found an antibiotic that agrees with me.

I went to the ER for bug bites that got huge and gave me a rash. At first, they gave me steroid cream and sent me off. Went back few hours later after they doubled in size. They gave me an antibiotic shot and 2 Bactrim pills to take there plus prescription for Bactrim 3x daily. Within 24 hours, the cellulitis was almost all gone. 48 hours, it just looks like light bruising. Thank you Bactrim! However, I do have a bad sore throat now!!

It's 1 in the morning and I am still having breathing problems after being rushed to the hospital due to an allergy to bactrim. They gave me an EpiPen its been 2 hours and I am still having trouble breathing. I'm very young and healthy and something like this  never happened to me before. I'm very scared and worried that taking this medicine has given me even worse problems. Has anyone else had this experience?

My husband was prescribed Bactrim in late April 2009 for what the dr thought was MRSA. Results came back negative and was told to continue taking it.4-7 days into his antibiotic and his gums bled after brushing his teeth...then his hands turned purple from pushing the lawn mower and under his arms he had petechiae. He was bleeding internally and he had a platelet count of 1,000 (he was very close to death and we didn't know it). The bactrim had caused the low platelet count which means the blood can't clot. He had to have 2 transfusions and then caught Meningitis as well. Bactrim is a very strong antibiotic; use with caution.

Bactrim for me gives me a sore on the bottom of my right foot. If I discontinue taking it the sore goes away but only now I realized it. I had a abscess yrs ago and took all of my medicine with one antibiotic was Bactrim and I was limping for days I then noticed a long red sore from my toes to the middle of my foot after treatment it formed a scab that eventually peeled off causing a dent on the bottom of my foot. Well today I forgot about the side effects of Bactrim and my same foot is starting to hurt again in the same exact spot. I think it is a Fixed drug eruption (FDE). I'm discontinuing this med for it does me no good...

Worst part of this was the size of the pill. Had to buy a pill cutter. Otherwise, it did make me a little moody and anxious but I did not have any other major symptoms. Took for 7 days for staph infection on skin.

I'm thinking some of the side effects commented were possibly results of the condition and not the medication. I have MRSA. Of course I have chills because the abscess  are a massive infection.  One person mentioned organ failure. MRSA entering the bloodstream would do that too. So far so good here- still early on. I was on clindamycin for a tooth abscess. I must have been unknowingly treating a mild staph infection. When the clindamycin stopped the bacteria became aggressive. Now here I am on Bactrim. One sore has lightened in color and pressure within 24 hours. The other sores still hurt, so I took ibuprofen.   You won't get headaches if taken with pain/ fever reducer.  The clindamycin wrecked my gut but I actually haven't had a hard time with the Bactrim. I've been sure to eat something or drink a glass of milk before taking it.

I recently had a boil lanced and was prescribed Bactrim. About 45 minutes after taking the first dose, which two tablets, I began to have a severe itch throughout my body. I tongue, throat, face and hands started to swell. Had to taken to the ER due to an anaphylactic reaction. I found out I am allergic to this type of medication. I am now leery of any type of new medication being prescribed.

I was very hesitant to take this drug after reading the reviews online. Indeed, I was prescribed it for a bacterial skin infection. However, it did little to nothing to eliminate my infection. On day 1 of taking it, I started getting minor headaches. Every time I took a dose after that it made my headache even worse. It just felt like I was putting something harmful in my body. If you're ever in a situation where you are prescribed it (and it's not a life or death situation), tell your doctor no. Do it it for your own body's sake.

I’m on a Day 4 of very high dose (2 tabls twice a day) and it’s about the same as when I took it years ago (so far). On second day felt queasy, tongue and lips a little irritable, gut uncomfortable, generally crummy. By end of third day better on all fronts and expect/hope to be ok (using for a MRSA boil; redness going away rapidly!). I (almost) eliminated refined sugar, drink lots of water, not too much sun. Why so many bad reviews? I guess people who do ok (vast majority) don’t visit the site or leave comments. Hope this helps.

I was prescribed Bactrim after having an abscess on my leg drained. I started feeling horrible immediately. Joint pain, nausea, loss of appetite, high fevers. I ended up in the hospital for 3 days for drug fever, and am still feeling the effects a week after coming home. I  would not suggest taking this.

Had a very hot and painful boil right on my belt line from shaving my pubic area. Went to the doc and he looked at it and said of the abscess was way too deep to Lance it put me on Bactroban ointment and high dose of Bactrim. After 2 days the infection started to clear up. As far as bactrim side effects not as bad as when I take penicillin mainly really bad headache, extreme thirst, frequent urination. Take probiotics at lunch to help with diarrhea

I had what I thought was a boil on the back of my leg so I went to the E. R the worst pain of my life cutting it open I left they gave me bactrim omg I woke up with the worst headache my body dried out cause of the medicine.  My lips cracked an bleed just by moving my lips, I went to a different E. R blood pressure is 181/164 I have shakes blurry vision, pain all over my body I have HIV and diabetes so I'm scared. They gave me tramadol and sent me home. I've got my husband writing this cause I'm so weak. So please doctors if you read this we know our bodies better then you and I should have been admitted  but the only excuse is I might pick up another infection. I can do that being out in the open smh I feel like I'm dying an nobody is listening

I had an incredibly bad reaction to Bactrim that led to Multiple Organ dysfunction / failure.  I ended up in ICU for several days with liver and kidney failure that progressed into a pulmonary edema / A.R.D.S..  I came very close to dying after my kidneys shot down and my lungs filled with fluid.  I have now been advised to never take another Sulfa based drug.

I broke out in blisters on face, scalp, and chest. These were oozing a clear sticky fluid that literally melted the skin it oozed over.  Tried everything over the counter and homeopathic but this flesh eating infection would not clear. Finally went to urgent care and was prescribed Bactrim for an assumed MRSA skin infection. Within The first 24 hours I had noticeable improvement. Sores weren't burning red and swollen, by 3rd day some scabs are already falling off with healthy pink skin underneath, no ooze, no new blisters. Day 5 you would hardly know I had a skin problem. All clear. Only side effect I had was loss of appetite. Didn't want to eat, nothing sounded good. Lost 4 pounds.  Not everyone reacts bad to Bactrim.

First and foremost I want to let you all know, reading things on the internet, WILL NOT help, nor really be a good indicator of your personal reaction to any drug. There are many negative reviews here for Bactrim, and I'm on day 3 of a 10 day dose for a staph infection (cellulitis) on, of all places the right side of my face/right ear (its wonderful!). Here's my experience:Side Effects: Fatigue, headaches (though not consistent). I have a weaker stomach, and its doing just fine with my probiotic (get one with 30billion strands) and drinking lots of water/eating while taking it. The infection is clearing up. Day 3 was when I really noticed. Don't be anxious when taking this, its definitely a mind over matter thing sometimes too.

I went to the Emergency room due to a hot burning stinging itchy rash on my hand with what seemed to be white welts. I was also experiencing some nausea and felt weak. The doctor examined my hand and diagnosed me with cellulitus. He perscribed me augmentin, which he knew I was allergic too. At least I noticed it before  I took it. He had to change my antibiotic to bactrim. I was given one dose at the hospital because no pharmacies were open on new years day.That night I felt a slight headache. The night seemed extremely longer than usual. Each hour, seemed like two or three. I didn't think the night was going to end. I was up every few hours, with a dry mouth. I also had an dream that was frightening,  it was of a friend stabbing me.

Side effects:Extreme exhaustion Extreme Irritability Inability to concentrate NauseaItching & skin peeling @ site of finger infection Vaginal SpottingBody aches Severe headachesRx was for 2x a day for 10 days for severe infection on end of finger with red streaks Completed medicine because infection was healing but side effects were substantial !

I was just prescribed this antibiotic today due to a staph infection in each leg from shaving. My doctor mentioned MSRA, needless to say I'm freaking out over this. Regardless, it's been about 4 hours since I took the first pill - obviously the infection sites haven't gotten any better, but I'm hoping they do. As far as side effects go, I'm lucky so far to only have a little bit of heartburn and slight nausea/loss of appetite. I'm crossing my fingers this stuff works for me!

Currently on day 3 of a 10 day antibiotic blast of Bactrim after 2 days on Keflex.  What I had originally thought was a pimple on my septum just inside my right nostril turned out to be a staph infection.  I had lances the "pimple" when it came to a head, thinking it would provide relief, however the infection spread across my nares and over the tip of my nose overnight.  Went to urgent care as I instantly suspected staph as the culprit and was prescribed Keflex and Bactroban topical until my follow up with my PCP.  Infection showed moderate improvement at my follow up, but was then prescribed Bactrim.  Within 24 hours the itch and swelling had completely subsided.  By 48 hours the sores were cluster-scabbing, and today they're falling off!

Though it did cure the abscess in my ear, it caused severe (I mean SEVERE) muscle/bone pain in my legs, abdomen, and diaphragm.  Later side effects were numbness with shooting pain in my left side leg and arm.  I can barely walk.  I had never taken Bacrtim before (sulfonamide).  I was also on cephilexin but I do not believe that was the problem because I've taken that without issues.  Please think twice before you take Bactrim.  For me, the benefits certainly did not outweigh the risks.  For now, I've lost my quality of life.

Went to the hospital for a migraine - come to find my body was toxic and had an internal infection throughout. Doctor prescribed Bactrim and by itself with no aspirin it got rid of the headache. Apparently it does the job, does it well and does it fast for ME.

Day 3 on BACTRIM due to MRSA. Abscess was lanced and drained 5 days ago. Swelling/Pain of the abscess has finally begun remission. I did suffer from the reported migraine headache all day yesterday and it was quite debilitating,  but no such headache today and I'm finally back at work. Also suffered from some seriously painful abdominal cramps that produced very loose/watery stool. Not much of an appetite today and feeling a little shaky so make sure you eat even if you don't want to. This drug is definitely very effective for treatment of MRSA. If the migraines were constant as others described I wouldn't not be back at work today. All my best wishes to everyone reading this.

Had cut my foot at a beach and was prescribed Bactrim, got the chills and chatteringteeth, told to continue and next day had severe diahareea and vomiting at same timehospitalized for several days, body bloated to twice my normal size, near died, wouldnever take a sulphur drug again especially Bactrim.

I was given Bactrim for vestibulitis, and a sinus infection, and bronchitis. The medicine was hardly effective. I just finished it. While on it all of my symptoms got worse and I had severe headaches and neck stiffness and I was so tired all day. I tried dealing with the side effects because I wasn't sure if it was the medicine or just being sick. Went back to my doctor today and because I'm not better he switched me to azothromycin and gave me some steroids for my energy levels. This medicine was awful. By the 7th day I was smelling and tasting the medicine all day. Really, I could've dealt with the side effects if the medicine helped me but it did not.

My daughter had a small red angry looking flea bite, or so we thought. We tried to draw it out with hot compress. NO go. Went to Urgent Care the next day. Was given Bacrim 800+160. That was a Saturday. Wound was 1 times worse the next day. Went to ER. Was told NOT to use hot compress but keep taking the Bactrim. Today is Tuesday. Taking this medication doesnt seem to be doing much. She is red, imflammed badly, full of nastyness and pain. Using crutches as this is on her lower leg. Seeing surgeon in 2 days because the infection is now to deep. She is in tons of pain. Thankfully there is no fever as of yet but infection is looking more and more like MRSA. Scary stuff on an 18 year old who is constantly keeping herself clean.
username: Still on the Fence on this one

review: I have just recently got out a living environment with a bunch of roomates, I found a small pimple under my arm and thought nothing of it, after a week it was so swollen and hot to touch I went to the ER. The doctor didn't want to cut the "pimple" open but I begged him to because of the pain-and he was glad he did...the amount of bacteria that came out was astonishing! He put me on bactrim and even though I had some side effects it went away.....but then I got another abcess on my head about 2 months later....took bactrim it went away....then 2 months after that i got another abcess on my finger....took bactrim it when away.....now i once again have 3 abscesses under my armpit and am currently on bactrim again! 4 months later!

I was prescribed Bactrim for a skin infection and took one pill.  Within less than an hour I was vomiting, shaking, sweating, and had severe diarrhea. I was literally unable to do anything but lay in bed with frequent bathroom trips for the next 24 hours.  It was horrible.  Never again.
Great med, but it always makes my lip swell and crack.....but the furuncle was gone!

I suddenly got a 5 angry red boils on my chin...and the next day another 10. I knew I better see a Doc quickly. My Doc prescribed Keflex 500mg, and said that in 3-4 days, it should start working.  But the boils kept spreading to my upper lip and cheeks. So, I got in touch with the Doc. He promptly changed the med to Bactrim 800/160, twice daily. With the second pill, I felt that the battle with the bacteria had changed. No more new boils were forming, and existing ones started  becoming black instead the fiery red. The black boils are hard and not painful to the touch. Now, it is only 2 days out of the 10 day dosage, but I feel I am on the way to recovery. I don't know what caused this infection but I switched out my old razor blade.

I was put on this medicine for a skin infection. I was reluctant to start it because of all the horror stories in the Internet. It does make me nauseous and it gives me a slight headache. Advil and Benadryl help with those side effects. I'm on the fourth day and my infection is nearly cleared. I was also given a Bactroban skin cream and that stuff is great. A pleasant side effect has been my skin clearing. I had perfect skin up until I hit 25 and then suddenly I had cystic acne on one side of my face. I was reluctant to take anything because it wasn't that bad, but the Bactrim has pretty much cleared it up.

I took Bactrim for a while now for bacteria of the hair follicles and it has helped a lot plus using dial soap. But every time I get boils it heals them. I don't have any side effects to the medicine. Every time I get this infection I have to take Bactrim because I can't take penicillin.

Contacted MRSA and received Bactrim for 14 days and cleared.Three years later contacted cellulitus from a wound not taken care of by me. Bactrim took care of it.  Dangerous conditions cured with Bactrim.

If you're ever on antibiotics, it's best to take a probiotic to help with stomach upset. However, I read you should take them as far away from your dose of antibiotic as possible. So, if you have to take it twice a day: take the Bactrim at breakfast and dinner. Then take the probiotics directly between at around lunch time. Taking any antibiotics with food also helps. Certain antibiotics have different food instructions so ask your pharmacist. I'm currently on Bactrim for a urinary tract infection, but I also have an infected hair that's been causing me a lot of pain in my groin so I'm hoping this will help there as well.

I was first prescribed Augmentin for an infection from a puncture wound near the nail bed of my thumb. It made me feel like I was suffering from morning sickness and did not work. Next I got Flagyl and Bactrim.  The culture showed the Staph was sensitive to Bactrim and the wound is SO much better! Yes, there are some side effects (for me, insomnia but I don't know if that is Flagyl or Bactrim) but it is so much better than losing my finger! I also took Florastor with the medication to reduce intestinal upset and experienced none.

Can't live without having this in by medicine cabinet. At the onset of a suspected boil I take this and problem solved! I have been taking this for many years. Before Bactrim I had boil after boil, scars, and embarrassment. Miracle drug for boils, who cares about minor side effects!!!
I've had a few skin infections and cellulitis. Bactrim cleared it, visible within 24hrs.

If you are prescribed Bactrim, take a probiotic with each pill and the side effects usually go away. Probiotics are over the counter. Before I could not take Bactrim or Keflex. Now no problem. I am on Bactrim for boils and taking the probiotic.
Cellulitis or staph infection on index finger. Went to doc he prescribed this. It's making the infection (large boil) go down and kind of scab over. Having bad heartburn though, and having headaches.
Taking Bactrim for spider bite on breast - working.
From the second dose of the medicine, I started having terrible heartburn, stomach burning and nausea. The side effects out-weighed any benefits for me.

I was prescribed Bactrim for a bacterial skin infection under my arm. I get infections easily and am often on all kinds of antibiotics. Many bother me, but I have not had any problems at all while on Bactrim. And the skin infection has been clearing up very well (I'm almost done with the medication.) I'm very happy with this medication.

I am currently taking this medicine. I should be finishing it in two days have to take it twice for ten days. The whole time I've had migraines. And just recently I got a rash because I forgot to take it once yesterday. I've never been allergic to anything but I hope this rash goes away.

I stepped on a rusty nail and had alot of pain and foot started to swell. I started taking Bactrim and the pain went away within the first two pills which was 24 hrs. The only problem is that I can't function with the nausea, dizziness, loss of appetite, headache. I think its because of sensitive stomach.

I went to the hospital last night because there was a boil under my armpit. Last month I had one on my buttock. They tested me for diabetes, I'm not a diabetic. I don't know why I keep getting boils. They couldn't drain it because fluid hasn't formed yet, so they gave me Bactrim. I have to take 2 pills every 12 hrs. They are huge. And hopefully they work well for me like they did for most of you!

Prescribed Bactrim for boils on abdomen/legs. I was only able to take it for 3 days, due to the adverse reaction. The boils are much better (and I hope they don't come back), but the back pain, abdominal pain, nausea and diarrhea were enough to make me stop taking it. Plus, I'm not sure if this is a medicine of choice for anyone with ulcerative colitis, but now I'm having a huge flare of that!
Awful nausea and headaches that last all day! I'd rather have those side effects then suffer from MRSA but it has still been rough to deal with as I'm trying to go back to work.

I cut my finger on a piece of metal under the seat of my car and developed a skin infection. Had the infection drained, but was also prescribed Bactrim twice a day for 10 days. After 2 days I saw my finger start healing up and within the 10 days it was completely healed. I only experienced mild nausea and some insomnia. Other than that it did a great job! Very satisfied.

I have been prescribed Bactrim for a skin infection in the form of 2 boils 1 on my arm and 1 on my leg. I have been prescribed Bactrim 800/ 160 2x per day for 10 days. Started feeling horrible after the first dose. Extreme dizziness, stomach issues, headache by day 3, feeling dehydrated with weakness and joint pain and jaw pain, loss of appetite, insomnia. I am on day 5 and the dizziness is really bad I had to miss work. Only took half a dose this morning and considering stopping. Thinking I may be allergic to the sulfonomide as my grandmother is allergic and this is the first time I have ever taken this. Glad to see others have had a good experience.

I am taking Bactrim for a minor staph infection on my leg. It is going away quickly. I am just experiencing fatigue and headaches. The headaches are probably due to dehydration because I am a runner too. I felt better after I drank more water with the medicine. Also I am experiencing a slight decrease in appetite.

I have had MSRA "boils" 3 times in the last 5 years. Each time I have been given a prescription for Bactrim specifically because its a sulfate based antibiotic - each time the infection made an almost immediate change for the better in size, swelling, and pain associated with those. I was fortunate enough NOT to experience any side effects and my overall opinion of this antibiotic is that for me it's been FANTASTIC in the treatment of MSRA.
I took Bactrim for a spider bite that was infected. The nausea and vomiting was unbearable but my wound was almost gone after a day. I think I would rather have vomiting than have an infection.

I took Bactrim for a bacterial infection under my skin, on my face, that resulted in many cystic like bumps. They were so painful. After taking the medicine for just a few days, the swelling and pain went away and the bumps cleared up. I would take this medicine again.
I took Bactrim for a boil on my face. After 2 days of taking, the boil began to drain but the nausea and stomach pain has been very uncomfortable.

I was prescribed this for a nasty spider bite that got infected. The infection started getting better after one day but the nausea is 24/7. I could hardly eat anything and had trouble sleeping because of the horrible feeling in my stomach. Was prescribed 2 pills a day for 10 days. The pills were large.

I was diagnosed with MRSA, a staph infection that is like small boils on the skin.  I was on Bactrim for two weeks and it seemed to clear it up.  Actually improved in a couple of days.  After a week of being off the Bactrim, I started getting the boils back.  Had to take another two weeks of Bactrim.

I had a very small cut next to my fingernail that turned into a full-blown staph infection (cellulitis. It very quickly (within 24 hours) spread up my finger to my second knuckle. My doctor prescribed 10 days of Bactrim and by the second day the infection began to subside. No side effects that I can think of.
My doctor gave me Bactrim for serious boils that developed in my underarm, the medication worked wonders.  My boils were better by the second day. I am very happy about the medication.

I began getting serious boils in the worst places a man could ever get them. A nurse friend of mine knowing I was diabetic said that many diabetics get boils in the genital area and suggested I take Bactrim. This drug cleared them up quickly,leaving me to be one happy man.
